citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) is not conducting program and facility reviews at least once
every six months. The most recent program and facility reviews were conducted on April 11, 2024, and March 27, 2025.
This is an interval of almost twelve months.
Additionally, the IACUC has not submitted the reports for their program and facility reviews to the Institutional Official (IO)
since July 13, 2023.
Conducting facility inspections less frequently than once every six months could delay the IACUC's detection and
subsequent correction of any departures from Animal Welfare Act. Not sending the reports for program and facility
reviews does not allow the IO to be made aware of any deficiencies and plans for correction. The IACUC, as an agent of
the research facility, shall review, at least once every six months, the research facility's program for humane care and use
of animals. The IACUC shall inspect, at least once every six months, all of the research facility's animal facilities, including
animal study areas. After completing the program review and the inspection of the animal facilities, the IACUC must
prepare reports of their evaluations, including minority opinions, that a majority of members must sign, and submit the
reports to the Institutional Official.
To be corrected from this date, August 29, 2025, forward for all future program and facility reviews.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(c) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) is not conducting program and facility reviews at least once 
every six months. The most recent program and facility reviews were conducted on April 11, 2024, and March 27, 2025. 
This is an interval of almost twelve months.  
Additionally, the IACUC has not submitted the reports for their program and facility reviews to the Institutional Official (IO) 
since July 13, 2023.  
Conducting facility inspections less frequently than once every six months could delay the IACUC's detection and 
subsequent correction of any departures from Animal Welfare Act. Not sending the reports for program and facility 
reviews does not allow the IO to be made aware of any deficiencies and plans for correction. The IACUC, as an agent of 
the research facility, shall review, at least once every six months, the research facility's program for humane care and use 
of animals. The IACUC shall inspect, at least once every six months, all of the research facility's animal facilities, including 
animal study areas. After completing the program review and the inspection of the animal facilities, the IACUC must 
prepare reports of their evaluations, including minority opinions, that a majority of members must sign, and submit the 
reports to the Institutional Official.  
To be corrected from this date, August 29, 2025, forward for all future program and facility reviews. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
